agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for low-income families with children. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities or other special circumstances. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided when available and within set boundaries.
taxonomy_name: Residential Placement Services for People With Disabilities
nameLevel4: Residential Placement Services for People With Disabilities
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.

site_schedule.name: Head Start
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Classes: Vary; morning and afternoon classes available

site_schedule.name: Food Vouchers
site_schedule.schedule: Case and Howard Counties: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Tipton County: by appointment only)

site_schedule.name: Residential Placement Services for People With Disabilities
Home Delivered Meals
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Meal Delivery: Mon-Fri noon

site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, or Wabash County -- Age 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% federal poverty guidelines
Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Seeking placement in a nursing home
Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- May be eligible for SNAP benefits (based on initial assessment, special circumstances, or at caller's request)
Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- People who are or will soon become eligible for Medicare

Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Age 60 or older, or any age or with disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source
Living in Indiana -- With earned income (from full or part-time employment) -- Able to save a minimum of $50 per month -- At or below 200% of the federal poverty guidelines

Living in the county where eligibility is being determined -- Age 60 or older -OR- Age 55 or older, person with disabilities that is living in housing for elderly and participating in a congregate nutrition service -- Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines, utilizing a confirmed agency service
Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Seniors or persons with disabilities and their family, caregivers, and advocates

Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Hot meal delivery limited to Kokomo, Logansport, Peru, Rochester, Tipton, and Wabash -- Frozen meal delivery available to those living in other parts of service area -- Homebound due to age (60 and older) or disability
Parents or grandparents of children under age 5

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry, and limited financial assistance..
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance for rent, utility bills, or medical bills for Royal Center persons experiencing a temporary and unexpected financial crisis. Assistance is based on individual assessment and availability of funds.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING & COMMUNITY SERVICES - LOGANSPORT
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County

agency_desc: A not-for-profit, county-owned, regional medical center serving people in Cass County and north central Indiana.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Cass County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 1pm and 3rd Mon 9am

site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 1pm and 3rd Mon 9am

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Logansport in Cass County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Logansport in Cass County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding city government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Logansport in Cass County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Logansport in Cass County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Logansport in Cass County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Logansport in Cass County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Logansport in Cass County.
site_details: Call for information, or to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Logansport in Cass County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Logansport in Cass County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the city of Logansport in Cass County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of Logansport.

The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Cass County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as radon, mosquitoes, and rodents. Conducts mold analysis and testing for lead, tap water, and soil contaminants.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Cass County.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney with claims equal to or less than $6,000. In Cass County, Superior Court 1 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Cass County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Cass County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Cass County
